Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Council Member Larry B. Seabrook.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Katz.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of August 14, 2008 be adopted as printed by Council Member Gentile.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Gentile moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of August 14, 2008 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices

Communication from the Democratic Organization of Queens County - Submitting for the Advice & Consent of the Council, the name of Jose M. Araujo, for appointment as the Queens County Democratic Commissioner of Elections, pursuant to Section 3 - 204 of the Election Law.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Jose M. Araujo, Queens County Democratic Commissioner of Elections

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 20080280 PCM shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, City Planning Commission (C20080280PCM)

Items.Title:
By the Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 20080279 PSM shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, City Planning Commission (C20080279PSM)

Items.Title:
By the Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 20080281 ZSM shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, City Planning Commission (C20080281ZSM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Brewer:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Applications no. C 080400 ZSM and C 080401 ZSM shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, City Planning Commission (C080400ZSM and C080401ZSM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Lappin:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an enclosed sidewalk café located at 1373 First Avenue Community Board 8, Application 20085680 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe,  1373 1st Café Inc. d.b.a. Banshee Pub, Manhattan (20085680TCM)

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges, and Elections
RESOLUTION APPROVING THE APPOINTMENT BY THE COUNCIL OF JOSE M. ARAUJO AS THE QUEENS COUNTY DEMOCRATIC COMMISSIONER OF ELECTIONS.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: M 1203 - Jose M. Araujo, Queens County Democratic Commissioner of Elections

Items.Title: Resolution urging the Federal Communications Commission to open a formal comment period on the Commission’s TV white space test report to enable all stakeholders to thoroughly review the data and comment, and to set aside a sufficient number of broadcast channels for the exclusive use of wireless microphone in order to protect all incumbent wireless microphone users.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Technology in Government
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Refrain from implementing proposed regulatory amendments that would allow portable devices to operate on the white space radio spectrum.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
Resolution calling upon the Department of Education to ensure that there are cameras, tracking systems and security personnel on all school buses.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Department of Education to ensure that there are cameras, tracking systems and security personnel on all school buses.

Items.Title: Resolution calling for a one-year moratorium on the use and expansion of CityTime surveillance technology used to track the time of City employees in order to properly assess its advantages and disadvantages.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Calling for a one-year moratorium on the use and expansion of CityTime surveillance technology.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign into law S.2386 and A.5673, which enact a bill of rights for cooperative shareholders and condominium unit owners and direct the Attorney General to promulgate a handbook summary of these rights and the procedures available to enforce them.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Higher Education
Items.MatterName: Enact a bill of rights for cooperative shareholders and condominium unit owners (S.2386/A.5673).

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Quinn), the Clerk of the Council adjourned to meet again on Wednesday, November 12, 2008.

MICHAEL McSWEENEY, First Deputy City Clerk
Acting Clerk of the Council
The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum).

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to term limits for elected officials.
Items.MinutesNote: CM Yassky's called to the floor a Motion to Amend Int No. 845-A.   Motion was defeated by a vote of 22-28-1:
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Council
Items.MatterName: Term limits for elected officials.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to term limits for elected officials.
Items.MinutesNote:
CM Yassky's called to the floor a Motion to Amend Int No. 845-A.   Motion was defeated by a vote of 22-28-1:

Affirmative - Addabbo, Avella, Barron, Brewer, DeBlasio, Eugene, Garodnick, Gennaro, Gentile, Gerson, Gioia, Ignizio, James, Liu, Mark-Viverito, McMahon, Mendez, Monserrate, Palma, Weprin, Yassky and Oddo - 22.

Negative - Arroyo, Baez, Como, Comrie, Dickens, Dilan, Felder, Fidler, Foster, Gonzalez, Jackson, Katz, Koppell, Lappin, Martinez, Mealy, Nelson, Recchia, Reyna, Seabrook, Sears, Stewart, Vacca, Vallone Jr., Vann, White, Rivera, and the Speaker (Council Quinn) - 28

Abstention- Sanders - 1.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Amendment Defeated by Council failed by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Term limits for elected officials.
